meanings.definition: Of or relating to aquatic plants.
meanings.sent1: The hydrophytic plants in the pond have adapted well to living in water.
meanings.sent2: Aquatic plants have hydrophytic characteristics that help them thrive in water.
meanings.sent3: The hydrophytic plants had a pool party and invited all their aquatic friends.
meanings.sent4: Her love for water was so deep, it was as if she had hydrophytic roots.
meanings.sent5: The hydrophytic nature of the plants made them look like they were dancing in the rain.

meanings.definition: Thriving in or adapted to aquatic environments.
meanings.sent1: The fish displayed hydrophytic behavior as they swam effortlessly in the lake.
meanings.sent2: The hydrophytic plants near the riverbank grew abundantly due to their adaptation to water.
meanings.sent3: The hydrophytic frogs organized a synchronized swimming competition in the pond.
meanings.sent4: Her ability to navigate through challenges was as impressive as a hydrophytic plant flourishing in water.
meanings.sent5: The hydrophytic ecosystem was a vibrant and lively community of aquatic organisms.
